title: The Wicked and God's Justice
shortSummary: Psalm 10 is a heartfelt plea to God in times of trouble, questioning His seeming distance while describing the arrogance and cruelty of the wicked. The psalmist calls on God to act justly on behalf of the poor and oppressed, affirming God's eternal kingship and faithfulness to the humble.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, traditionally attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: A proud and deceitful individual who oppresses the poor and trusts in his own strength rather than God.

keyCharacters.name: The Poor
keyCharacters.description: The vulnerable and oppressed whom the wicked persecutes and whom the psalmist calls God to defend.

keyCharacters.name: The Humble
keyCharacters.description: Those who rely on God and seek His justice, whose desires and prayers God hears and answers.

definitions.definition: An attitude of arrogance and self-exaltation that leads one to reject God and oppress others.
Hidden or secret locations where the wicked lie in wait to harm the innocent.
Orphans or those without protection, symbolizing the vulnerable who need God's care and justice.
God’s righteous decisions and actions to uphold justice and punish wickedness.

outline.heading: The Psalmist’s Cry and Description of the Wicked
outline.description: The psalmist questions why God seems distant in times of trouble and describes the wicked’s pride, deceit, and disregard for God.

outline.heading: The Wicked’s Secret Violence and Arrogance
outline.description: The psalmist portrays the wicked as a predator who hides to harm the poor and boasts that God will not see or punish him.

outline.heading: A Call for God’s Intervention
outline.description: The psalmist appeals to God to arise and act against the wicked, to remember the humble, and to break the power of evil.

outline.heading: God’s Eternal Kingship and Justice for the Oppressed
outline.description: The psalmist affirms God’s everlasting reign and His commitment to hearing the humble and judging the oppressed so that injustice ceases.

application: Trust God in times of trouble even when He seems distant, remembering He is sovereign over all circumstances.
Reject pride and arrogance, seeking humility before God and compassion toward the vulnerable.
Pray earnestly for God’s justice to prevail against wickedness and for protection of the oppressed.
Rest in the assurance that God hears the prayers of the humble and will ultimately judge all wrongdoing.

keyVerses.text: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
keyVerses.significance: This opening verse expresses the honest struggle of faith when God’s presence feels distant in suffering.

keyVerses.text: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful plea for God’s active intervention on behalf of the humble and oppressed.

keyVerses.text: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
keyVerses.significance: A confident declaration of God’s eternal kingship and sovereign authority over all nations.

keyVerses.text: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s purpose in judging: to protect the vulnerable and end oppression.
